29 
30 /*
31  * job.c -- Generic state-machine interface. The point of this is
32  * that we need to be able to suspend and resume processing at any
33  * point at which the buffers may block. We could do that using
34  * setjmp or similar tricks, but this is probably simpler.
35  *
36  * TODO: We have a few functions to do with reading a netint, stashing
37  * it somewhere, then moving into a different state. Is it worth
38  * writing generic functions fo r that, or would it be too confusing?
39  */
40

56 static const int rs_job_tag = 20010225;
57 
58 static rs_result rs_job_work(rs_job_t *job, rs_buffers_t *buffers);
59 
60 
61 rs_job_t * rs_job_new(char const *job_name, rs_result (*statefn)(rs_job_t *))
62 {
63  rs_job_t *job;
64 
65  job = rs_alloc_struct(rs_job_t);
66 
67  job->job_name = job_name;
68  job->dogtag = rs_job_tag;
69  job->statefn = statefn;
70 
71  job->stats.op = job_name;
72 
73  rs_trace("start %s job", job_name);
74 
75  return job;
76 }
77 
78 
79 void rs_job_check(rs_job_t *job)
80 {
81  assert(job->dogtag == rs_job_tag);
82 }
83 
84 
85 rs_result rs_job_free(rs_job_t *job)
86 {
87  if (job->scoop_buf)
88  free(job->scoop_buf);
89 
90  rs_bzero(job, sizeof *job);
91  free(job);
92 
93  return RS_DONE;
94 }
95 
96 
97 
98 static rs_result rs_job_s_complete(rs_job_t *job)
99 {
100  rs_fatal("should not be reached");
101  return RS_INTERNAL_ERROR;
102 }
103 
104 
105 static rs_result rs_job_complete(rs_job_t *job, rs_result result)
106 {
107  rs_job_check(job);
108 
109  job->statefn = rs_job_s_complete;
110  job->final_result = result;
111 
112  if (result != RS_DONE) {
113  rs_error("%s job failed: %s", job->job_name, rs_strerror(result));
114  } else {
115  rs_trace("%s job complete", job->job_name);
116  }
117 
118  if (result == RS_DONE && !rs_tube_is_idle(job))
119  /* Processing is finished, but there is still some data
120  * waiting to get into the output buffer. */
121  return RS_BLOCKED;
122  else
123  return result;
124 }
125 
126 
137 rs_result rs_job_iter(rs_job_t *job, rs_buffers_t *buffers)
138 {
139  rs_result result;
140  rs_long_t orig_in, orig_out;
141 
142  orig_in = buffers->avail_in;
143  orig_out = buffers->avail_out;
144 
145  result = rs_job_work(job, buffers);
146 
147  if (result == RS_BLOCKED || result == RS_DONE)
148  if ((orig_in == buffers->avail_in) && (orig_out == buffers->avail_out)
149  && orig_in && orig_out) {
150  rs_log(RS_LOG_ERR, "internal error: job made no progress "
151  "[orig_in=" PRINTF_FORMAT_U64 ", orig_out=" PRINTF_FORMAT_U64 ", final_in=" PRINTF_FORMAT_U64 ", final_out=" PRINTF_FORMAT_U64 "]",
152  PRINTF_CAST_U64(orig_in), PRINTF_CAST_U64(orig_out), PRINTF_CAST_U64(buffers->avail_in),
153  PRINTF_CAST_U64(buffers->avail_out));
154  return RS_INTERNAL_ERROR;
155  }
156 
157  return result;
158 }
159 
160 
161 static rs_result
162 rs_job_work(rs_job_t *job, rs_buffers_t *buffers)
163 {
164  rs_result result;
165 
166  rs_job_check(job);
167 
168  if (!buffers) {
169  rs_error("NULL buffer passed to rs_job_iter");
170  return RS_PARAM_ERROR;
171  }
172  job->stream = buffers;
173 
174  while (1) {
175  result = rs_tube_catchup(job);
176  if (result == RS_BLOCKED)
177  return result;
178  else if (result != RS_DONE)
179  return rs_job_complete(job, result);
180 
181  if (job->statefn == rs_job_s_complete) {
182  if (rs_tube_is_idle(job))
183  return RS_DONE;
184  else
185  return RS_BLOCKED;
186  } else {
187  result = job->statefn(job);
188  if (result == RS_RUNNING)
189  continue;
190  else if (result == RS_BLOCKED)
191  return result;
192  else
193  return rs_job_complete(job, result);
194  }
195  }
196 
197  /* TODO: Before returning, check that we actually made some
198  * progress. If not, and we're not returning an error, this is a
199  * bug. */
200 }
201

206 const rs_stats_t *
207 rs_job_statistics(rs_job_t *job)
208 {
209  return &job->stats;
210 }

213 int
214 rs_job_input_is_ending(rs_job_t *job)
215 {
216  return job->stream->eof_in;
217 }

220 
225 rs_result
226 rs_job_drive(rs_job_t *job, rs_buffers_t *buf,
227  rs_driven_cb in_cb, void *in_opaque,
228  rs_driven_cb out_cb, void *out_opaque)
229 {
230  rs_result result, iores;
231 
232  rs_bzero(buf, sizeof *buf);
233 
234  do {
235  if (!buf->eof_in && in_cb) {
236  iores = in_cb(job, buf, in_opaque);
237  if (iores != RS_DONE)
238  return iores;
239  }
240 
241  result = rs_job_iter(job, buf);
242  if (result != RS_DONE && result != RS_BLOCKED)
243  return result;
244 
245  if (out_cb) {
246  iores = (out_cb)(job, buf, out_opaque);
247  if (iores != RS_DONE)
248  return iores;
249  }
250  } while (result != RS_DONE);
251 
252  return result;
253 }
